content: Dr. Patil said the animal husbandry sector forms the backbone of the rural economy, and farmers‚Äô income can be enhanced by adopting scientific methods, modern technology and animal welfare practices.

content: Rubfarm‚Äôs first product is a range of grow bags made using rubber sheets sourced from farmers who are shareholders of the company

title: Sources: Suns' Brooks suffered broken left hand
content: Suns guard Dillon Brooks broke his left hand in Saturday's game against Orlando and is expected to miss an extended period of time, sources told ESPN.

title: Boozer leads Blue Devils past Wolverines in D.C.
content: Cameron Boozer scored 18 points and the No. 3 Duke Blue Devils handed another neutral-site loss to fellow blueblood Michigan, knocking off the top-ranked Wolverines 68-63 on Saturday night in a raucous possible Final Four preview in the nation's capital.

title: Sources: Cowboys agree to deal with RB Williams
content: The Cowboys and free-agent-to-be running back Javonte Williams reached agreement on a three-year contract that includes $16 million in guaranteed money, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Saturday.

title: Arizona handles Houston, owns 1st place in Big 12
content: Senior guard Anthony Dell'Orso tied a season high with 22 points, and No. 4 Arizona toppled second-ranked Houston 73-66 on Saturday -- the Wildcats' 25th victory of the season -- to move into sole possession of first place in the Big 12 Conference.

title: Tkachuk on Canada rivalry: 'There's hatred there'
content: On the eve of the Olympic gold medal game, Brady Tkachuk said for the U.S. to win its ultimate goal, his teammates will have to take down Canada, the team they both envy and despise.

title: St. John's wins 13th straight, longest in 41 years
content: St. John's breezed past Creighton on Saturday for its 13th straight victory -- marking the program's longest winning streak in 41 years.

title: Sources: New WNBA proposal includes housing
content: The WNBA submitted a new collective bargaining agreement proposal on Friday that would guarantee housing for all players in 2026, sources said.

title: Stephens, Altidore ending marriage after 4 years
content: Former U.S. Open tennis champion Sloane Stephens and former U.S. men's national soccer player Jozy Altidore are ending their marriage after four years.

content: The Bulldogs padded their NCAA tournament case with another key victory just days after beating Kentucky.

content: The Blue Devils have won 17 consecutive games. They're undefeated in ACC play. But they remain a 3-seed.

title: Karan Adani Outlines Growth Priorities As Adani Group Navigates Rapid Expansion
content: The Adani Group is strengthening its focus on national infrastructure priorities, defence-linked ecosystems and internal governance as it navigates rapid expansion, Karan Adani said on Saturday.

title: Business Leadership Is Built By People And Values, Says Karan Adani
content: The recognition truly belongs to the people who work tirelessly across the Adani Group, Karan Adani, Managing Director of Adani Ports and SEZ Limited, said on Saturday.

title: Trump Hikes Global Tariffs From 10% To 15% Day After Big Supreme Court Order
content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday raised the global tariffs from 10 per cent to 15 per cent after a big setback in Supreme Court on Friday.

title: Karnataka BJP MLA Chandru Lamani Arrested In Bribery Case
content: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MLA Chandru Lamani, representing the Shirahatti Assembly constituency, was caught red handed and taken into custody by the Karnataka Lokayukta on Saturday.

title: PM Modi's Pitch For Made In India Chips For Developed Nation
content: The foundation of developed India will be laid on the basis of self-reliance for which having chips made in India is very important, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Saturday.

title: Karan Adani Named Business Leader Of The Year At 2026 AIMA Awards. Full List Here
content: Karan Adani, Managing Director of Adani Ports & SEZ Ltd and Adani Cement Ltd, has been honoured with the Business Leader of the Year award at the 2026 Managing India Awards organised by the All India Management Association (AIMA).

title: Stopping Exodus, Finalising Allies: Priyanka Gandhi's Key Challenges In Assam
content: Former Assam Congress chief Bhupen Borah, who is set to join the BJP on Sunday, said several other leaders will also make the switch by March 8.

title: Adani Group Working To Restart F1 In Greater Noida, Says Karan Adani
content: The Adani Group is working on strategies to restart the Formula 1 motor sport at the Buddh International Circuit in Greater Noida, Karan Adani, the MD of Adani Cement said on Saturday.

title: Police Case Against UP Seer To Probe Sexual Abuse Allegations Against Him
content: A special POCSO court here on Saturday ordered the Jhunsi Police Station SHO to register an FIR against Swami Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati to investigate allegations of sexual abuse of boys.

title: Rohit Pawar Seeks Minister's Resignation Over Ajit Pawar Plane Crash
content: Rohit Pawar, nephew of former Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar, has questioned the ongoing investigation into the plane crash that killed his uncle, raising concerns about potential conflicts of interest and irregularities.

title: Born With Immobile Hands, Odisha Girl Writes Matric Exam With Foot
content: As rows of students bent over their answer sheets during the matriculation examination in Odisha's Malkangiri district, one candidate stood out, calmly writing her paper with her foot.

title: Kashmir Records Its Hottest February Day In History
content: Kashmir recorded its hottest February day on record today as temperatures soared to 21 degrees Celsius. In Srinagar, the maximum temperature was more than 11 degrees above normal - marking the warmest February day in the region's history.

title: "Fine If They Took It All": US Envoy On Israel Taking Over Middle East
content: The US ambassador to Israel, Mike Huckabee, has told podcaster Tucker Carlson that Israel has a biblical right to big portions of the Middle East and suggested it would be acceptable if the country took the entire region.

title: SIR Done In 6 states, 68 Lakh Voters Deleted In Gujarat, Highest In Country
content: The Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls has been completed across six states and Union Territories across India, with significant changes recorded in voter lists.

title: 88 Nations Adopt New Delhi Declaration, Back India's "AI For All" Vision
content: India's vision for a democratised and inclusive artificial intelligence framework has received sweeping global endorsement, with the AI Impact Summit 2026 concluding in the capital with the adoption of the New Delhi Declaration.

title: Adopted By A US War Veteran, An Iran-Born Woman Now Faces Deportation
content: A woman adopted as a toddler by an American war veteran, who he found in the 1970s in an Iranian orphanage and raised as a Christian, is being threatened with deportation to Iran.

title: Serbia, Sweden Urge Citizens To Quit Iran As Trump Mulls Strike
content: Serbia and Sweden have urged their citizens in Iran to leave the country after US President Donald Trump threatened military action over the Islamic republic's nuclear programme.

title: Ukrainian Drones Strike Industrial Site Deep Inside Russia, 11 Injured
content: Ukrainian drones struck an industrial site deep inside Russia on Saturday, which a Russian news channel said was a key state-owned missile factory.

title: 'Bombed our civilian compatriots': 'Dozens' killed after Pakistan conducts airstrikes in Afghanistan
content: Afghanistan reported dozens killed and wounded after Pakistan conducted airstrikes in eastern border provinces, targeting alleged militant camps. Pakistan stated the strikes were in response to recent suicide attacks, including one by an Afghan national. Tensions escalate as Pakistan warns of further action if Afghan soil is used for terrorism.

title: Incensed Trump raises tariffs from 10% to 15% causing more trade turmoil
content: President Trump escalated global tariffs to 15% following a Supreme Court rebuff, citing Section 122 of the Trade Act to address balance-of-payments deficits. This move, driven by pique, is expected to disrupt global trade and faces potential legal challenges due to inconsistent trade balances with various nations.

title: Bride's pet dog sparks violent clash in UP, wedding cancelled
content: A wedding in Fatehpur turned violent after a pet dog's barking led to a brawl between the bride's and groom's families. The disturbance during rituals escalated when the groom's side allegedly attacked the animal, resulting in a physical fight. At least five people were injured, and the ceremony was called off. No formal complaint has been lodged yet.

title: 57-year-old kidnapped Sikh man found dead in US
content: Avtar Singh, a 57-year-old cook at a California gurdwara, has been found dead after being kidnapped. Surveillance footage showed him being forced into a white SUV by three unidentified individuals. Singh had previously served at the Damdami Taksal headquarters.

title: T20 WC: Can Pakistan still qualify for semi-final after PAK vs NZ washout?
content: Rain washed out the Pakistan vs New Zealand Super 8 match, with both teams sharing one point and the semi-final race wide open. Pakistan must beat England and Sri Lanka to reach five points and likely qualify, while any loss could make their chances depend on other results. New Zealand face a similar situation, with wins now crucial to stay in control of their campaign.

title: What Obama said about UFO files that made Trump say 'he made a big mistake'
content: President Trump has ordered the release of government files concerning UFOs and extraterrestrial life, citing immense public interest. This follows former President Obama's remarks on the topic. While the US government acknowledges Unidentified Aerial Phenomena (UAP) are real, reports indicate no confirmed extraterrestrial origins, with many sightings attributed to mundane objects or advanced US technology.

title: India & Brazil sign rare earths pact, will ‚Äòwait and watch‚Äô US SC tariff order fallout
content: India and Brazil inked a critical minerals agreement and set a $30 billion trade target by 2030, aiming to build resilient supply chains and reduce dependence on China. Leaders also discussed UN reforms and technology cooperation, emphasizing Global South solidarity and shared progress.

title: Bezos's ex-wife's record $7.2bn donation in 2025 called 'bad donation', Musk agrees
content: Philanthropist MacKenzie Scott has donated billions rapidly, but Y Combinator CEO Garry Tan criticizes her approach, calling it "bad" due to a lack of oversight and accountability. Tan argues this "spray and pray" method can lead to mismanagement and unintended negative consequences for recipient organizations.

title: 120 strike rate, just three sixes: SKY says Tilak Varma 'told to bat that way'
content: Captain Suryakumar Yadav backed Tilak Varma, stating his batting approach aligns with team strategy, especially after early wickets. While acknowledging Tilak's personal dissatisfaction, Yadav expressed confidence in his ability to perform. He dismissed suggestions of replacing Tilak and highlighted the team's adaptability to challenging pitches, emphasizing faith in the bowling unit to defend scores.

title: FBI warns of ATM Jackpotting incidents across America: All you need to know
content: The FBI has issued a warning about ATM jackpotting malware, like Ploutus, which allows threat actors to dispense cash by exploiting physical and software vulnerabilities.  These attacks bypass bank authorization, leading to significant financial losses.  The FBI urges organizations to implement mitigation steps and report suspicious activity.

title: 'O Romeo' day 9: Shahid Kapoor's film crosses Rs 52.6 crore
content: After just nine days, Shahid Kapoor‚Äôs 'O Romeo' is making waves at the box office, surpassing an impressive Rs 52 crore. Saturday marked a significant uptick in audience attendance, with many praising the film‚Äôs engaging storytelling. In a heartwarming moment, Hrithik Roshan endorsed Kapoor's performance, labeling him the 'BEST' in the romantic genre.

title: After tariff setback, Trump attacks US companies & attorneys with India ties
content: President Trump fiercely attacked the Supreme Court after it struck down his tariffs, accusing the justices of being "lapdogs for the radical left" and influenced by foreign interests. He specifically targeted Indian-American attorneys involved in the case. The ruling, a 6-3 decision, reinforced Congress's trade powers, marking a significant setback for the President's executive actions.

title: Magic vs Suns Feb 20 2026: injury report, status, H2H & team stats updates
content: Orlando Magic and Phoenix Suns clash Saturday with key players sidelined.  Orlando, leading the Southeast Division, faces a Suns team second in the Pacific.  With scoring threats out, expect role players and bench units to shine.  Rebounding and free-throw advantage could tip the scales for Orlando in this crucial positioning game.

title: Kamila Sellier shares hospital update after Olympic blade accident
content: Polish speed skater Kamila Sellier is recovering after a skate blade cut her face during the women‚Äôs 1500 meters quarterfinal at the Winter Olympics. She had surgery and suffered a minor fracture, according to BBC and Polsat Sports. Sellier shared a hospital photo and said she is ‚Äúdoing quite okay‚Äù as doctors continue testing her eye.

title: Travis Kelce‚Äôs fianc√©e Taylor Swift sparks Swiftie moment at Mikaela Shiffrin‚Äôs gold win
content: Mikaela Shiffrin celebrated her 2026 Winter Olympics slalom gold with Taylor Swift lyrics on Instagram, then got a 1-word comment from the pop star: ‚ÄúHISTORIC ������.‚Äù Inside how Shiffrin uses ‚ÄúRuin the Friendship‚Äù to fuel races, why Swift‚Äôs reply mattered, and how the singer keeps stealing scenes at the Winter Games with Breezy Johnson too.

title: Pakistan strikes militant camps along Afghanistan border after deadly suicide attacks
content: Pakistan launched targeted strikes inside Afghanistan against militant hideouts, blaming the Pakistani Taliban for a recent surge in deadly attacks.  Information Minister Attaullah Tarar confirmed "intelligence-based, selective operations" against TTP camps and an Islamic State affiliate.  This action follows recent suicide bombings, with Islamabad warning of continued operations irrespective of location.

title: Shikhar Dhawan ties the knot with Sophie Shine
content: Former Indian opener Shikhar Dhawan tied the knot with his girlfriend Sophie Shine on February 21, and wishes have been pouring in from the cricketing and Bollywood fraternities ever since. As soon as the couple shared glimpses from their wedding ceremony, the comment section was flooded with congratulatory messages from friends and celebrities including Ranveer Singh, Jacqueline Fernandez, Sunil Grover among others.

title: Nick Goepper‚Äôs girlfriend fianc√©e Corrinn Childs: NFL cheerleader & love story
content: American freestyle skier Nick Goepper has shared happy personal news just days before returning to the Winter Olympics spotlight. The Lawrenceburg, Indiana native announced that he is engaged to his longtime girlfriend Corrinn Childs. He revealed the update on social media along with photos of the proposal. The couple got engaged in Aspen, Colorado.

title: Agartala-Dhaka direct bus trial runs held, service likely to resume soon
content: Trial runs for the Agartala‚ÄìDhaka direct bus service have been completed, signaling a potential resumption of commercial operations after a year-long suspension. This development follows directives from Bangladesh's new administration and aims to revive a crucial route linking India's Northeast to Kolkata via Dhaka, with tourist visa services also expected to restart soon.

title: 'I thought it was a muscle pull': Early symptoms of slipped discs explained
content: Back pain is often brushed off as just another muscle strain, but it may actually indicate a slipped disc, a frequent culprit behind nerve-related problems. Dr. Sanjay Kapoor emphasizes that if you're experiencing ongoing or radiating pain, alongside any numbness or weakness, these are warning signs not to be ignored.

title: Poll rolls shrink by 1.7 crore (8%) in 9 states/UTs under SIR Phase 2
content: Nine states in Phase 2 of the special intensive revision (SIR) have seen their combined electorate drop by 7.9% to 19.7 crore. Over 1.7 crore electors were removed, with Andaman & Nicobar and Gujarat experiencing the steepest declines. Three states are yet to publish their final rolls.

title: Rangers place Matt Rempe on injured reserve after thumb surgery
content: New York Rangers forward Matt Rempe will miss upcoming games. He requires another procedure on his thumb and has been placed on injured reserve. Rempe sustained the injury earlier this season during a fight. He is expected to be sidelined for several weeks as he recovers. The Rangers will face the Philadelphia Flyers without him.

title: BJP will deport infiltrators in 5 yrs if it returns to power: Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah vowed to remove infiltrators from Assam's electoral rolls and deport them within five years if the BJP returns to power. He accused the opposition of turning infiltrators into a vote bank, claiming they encroached on vast tracts of land.

title: How can Pakistan qualify for semi-final after rain washes out PAK vs NZ?
content: The Pakistan vs New Zealand Super 8 match was washed out due to rain, with both teams sharing one point. Pakistan and New Zealand now need wins in their remaining matches to qualify for the semi-finals. Any loss could complicate their chances and force them to rely on other results, while the washout keeps the group wide open for other teams.

title: Ellyse Perry makes history, becomes only Australian cricketer to achieve this feat
content: Ellyse Perry has achieved a historic milestone, becoming the first Australian woman to play 350 international cricket matches. Her remarkable career, which began at 16, now sees her among the most capped players globally. Perry's versatility is highlighted by her dual international representation in cricket and football, a feat unmatched by any other Australian woman.

title: Drake Maye net worth 2026: contract, salary and career earnings breakdown
content: How much is Drake Maye worth? Breaking down the Patriots quarterback's rookie contract, guaranteed money, college NIL earnings, and brand partnerships with Nike, Lowe's, and major companies.

title: Nasa flags possible Artemis II mission delay after rocket helium flow anomaly
content: NASA's Artemis II mission faces potential delays after engineers detected a helium flow interruption in the Space Launch System rocket's propulsion stage. This issue may necessitate rolling the rocket back to the Vehicle Assembly Building, impacting the early March launch window. The announcement follows a successful wet dress rehearsal and astronaut quarantine.

title: Betting on just gold and silver for long-term wealth creation? Think again
content: A commonly asked question in the minds of investors is: where should the hard earned money be put to earn the best returns? Over a 1-year, 5-year and 10-year time period, which asset class has offered the highest returns - gold, silver or equities?

title: UP court orders FIR against Swami Avimukteshwaranand in sexual exploitation case
content: A special POCSO court in Prayagraj has ordered the police to register an FIR against Swami Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati and his disciple over sexual exploitation allegations. This directive follows a complaint filed by Ashutosh Brahmachari Maharaj. The move occurs amidst ongoing controversy surrounding Swami Avimukteshwaranand, including a recent protest over being prevented from a ritual dip at Sangam.

title: Candace Owens under fire as witness disputes Charlie Kirk shooting claims
content: Candace Owens faces backlash after Tracy Martin, a friend of Charlie Kirk‚Äôs widow Erika Kirk, rejected Owens‚Äô claim that she had prior knowledge of Kirk‚Äôs 2025 assassination. In an interview, Martin called the narrative ‚Äúmanipulative‚Äù and criticized conspiracy framing. The exchange has fueled online criticism, with many urging Owens to retract her allegations.

title: PAK vs NZ Rain Washout: Who benefits and who is in danger in Super 8s?
content: Rain washed out the Pakistan vs New Zealand Super 8 match, with both teams sharing one point, which complicates the semi-final race. Pakistan and New Zealand now need wins in their remaining matches to stay on track, as any slip-up could hurt their chances. England and Sri Lanka benefit from the open group, while Pakistan and New Zealand miss a chance to gain an early advantage in the tight Super 8 battle.

title: Ukraine strikes Russia: 11 injured as Kyiv targets Moscow's industrial site
content: Ukraine launched drone and missile strikes deep inside Russia, targeting an industrial site in Udmurtia producing ballistic missiles and a gas processing plant in Samara. The Votkinsk facility reported injuries and damage, while Russian airports temporarily suspended operations. This follows stalled peace talks and continued Russian drone attacks on Ukrainian cities.

title: Shikhar Dhawan ties knot with girlfriend Sophie Shine, pic goes viral
content: Former India cricketer Shikhar Dhawan married Sophie Shine in a private ceremony on February 21. The couple had been dating for over a year and announced their engagement in January. Wedding photos went viral after Yuzvendra Chahal shared them online. This is Dhawan‚Äôs second marriage after his 2023 separation from Ayesha Mukherjee. Despite past custody issues involving his son Zoravar, Dhawan has begun a new chapter with Sophie Shine.

title: Colombo rain: What is the cut-off time for PAK vs NZ match?
content: Rain has delayed the Pakistan vs New Zealand T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8 match in Colombo, with drizzle covering the ground. Overs will start being cut after 8:10 PM IST, and the latest start for a five-over game is 10:16 PM IST. Pakistan recalled Fakhar Zaman, while New Zealand welcomed back Mitchell Santner and Lockie Ferguson. Fans await weather updates.

title: The $170Bn question: US SC junks Trump tariffs, but who will get the refunds?
content: The Supreme Court invalidated Trump's tariffs, leaving billions in collected duties in limbo. While the administration previously promised refunds, the process remains unclear, with individual importers potentially needing to file lawsuits. This ruling, which affirmed Congress's power to tax, has left companies and countries awaiting further guidance.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: U.S.' first-ever mass start medal, women's freeski halfpipe final postponed
content: The penultimate day at the Olympics felt like the calm before the storm. After Team USA women's ice hockey won gold against Canada in a thrilling match on Thursday, the American men followed up by advancing to the gold medal match by defeating Slovakia on Friday. They'll have a day off before facing Canada in the gold medal match Sunday, the last event of the 2026 Winter Olympics before the closing ceremony. That's not to say there was nothing happening on Saturday. Team USA women's curling fell short in a bronze medal match against Canada, and Mia Manganello won a bronze medal in the mass start, the U.S.'s first medal in that event. MORE:   Medal tracker  |  Full schedule of events  |  Olympics 101 Follow live with the best events from Saturday below.

title: Delhi Declaration: 86 nations back India's 'AI for All' push
content: Manash Pratim Gohain is a seasoned journalist with over two decades at The Times of India, where he has built a rich body of work spanning education policy, politics, and governance. Renowned for his incisive coverage of the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, accreditation reforms, and skilling initiatives, he has also reported on student politics, urban policy, and social movements. His political reportage‚Äîboth reflective and news-driven‚Äîadds depth to his writing, bridging policy with public impact. Through his 2,500 articles and related outlets, he has emerged as a trusted voice in national discourse, particularly in linking education reform to broader societal change. Read More
